fields.description: Import instance 400 error when user data is supplied in the request using: LaunchSpecification.UserData It doesn't see to matter what string is provided, the error is the same. Thanks, -M {code} [root@g-05-01 ~]# euca-import-instance /root/cirrosraw.img -b eutester_import_cirrosraw.img -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields -g fields.summary: euca-import-instance error when attempting to use user-data
fields.environment:

comments.body:
It looks like the (currently) expected parameter name is LaunchSpecification.UserData.Data rather than LaunchSpecification.UserData? A binding error may not have been thrown for this issue prior to the fix for EUCA-12049.

A similar issue was previously fixed for EUCA-9428, though perhaps with the wrong user data parameter name?

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_ImportInstance.html
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_ImportInstanceLaunchSpecification.html
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_UserData.html
Thanks [~sjones]. [~gholms] should I open a separate tools ticket for this one?
We suspect a tools change caused this. Let's try with the older version?

Little more info... I tested with 3.2.0 tools (euca2ools 3.2.0-pre1-4-g8a4f8c8 (Apollo)). This failed: {code} 2016-06-17 13:09:49,595 DEBUG EC2 request method: POST 2016-06-17 13:09:49,595 DEBUG EC2 request url: https://ec2.d-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ 2016-06-17 The binding error can be suppressed using:

{code}
#
# euctl bootstrap.webservices.unknown_parameter_handling=ignore
bootstrap.webservices.unknown_parameter_handling = ignore
#
{code}

this causes all unknown EC2 query API parameters to be ignored (when compared to the default setting)

We may want to verify that the import is successful (but without user data) with this configuration change in place.

[~mclark], are you set up to quickly test Steve's suggestion above?

[~sjones], is the setting one that we should use by default? Or recommend setting under some circumstances?

I'll re-target for 4.3.0 for now, until we decide what the action for 4.3 is going to be.

Thanks [~sjones] [~dmitrii], 
I tested with "bootstrap.webservices.unknown_parameter_handling" set to 'ignore'. This allows the request to be accepted w/o the binding error but the system still fails to produce the user-data. This still differs from 4.2.2 behavior. 
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/view/All/job/eutester-import-instance-linux/
The test has a check for the param and compares it to the user-data in the resulting imported instance attributes. 
From the test history it looks like this was passing for 4.2.2, but the only 4.3 test run before the cut-over failed (Build #271).  

I ran the test in this env today and it also catches this:
{code}
[06-22 09:06:37][ERROR][test2_validate_params_against_task]: Error checking task user-data:
"Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "import_instance.py", line 718, in validate_params_against_task
    self.assertEquals(user_data, ins_user_data)
  File "import_instance.py", line 359, in assertEquals
    assert x == y, str(x) + ' is not equal to ' + str(y)
AssertionError: #cloud-config
disable_root: false is not equal to None
{code}

Thanks, 
-M

I tested this with 4.2.2 and with 4.3 and there is a regression in the binding for import instance user data. There's no change in the message but a fix in the binding framework means the (incorrect) binding for this parameter no longer works.

The changeset for a candidate fix is:

https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/0d5f5dbdbf4d82ba77cc

Most of the change is the addition of a new test that covers this functionality, the fix itself touches a few lines.

The fix allows either of the following parameter names to be used:

{code}
LaunchSpecification.UserData
LaunchSpecification.UserData.Data
{code}

I ran this through a QA sequence:

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/4373/

so am ready to merge if we want to put this fix in 4.3.
